text:
<@U6W3H6YN8> and <@U7ADCU3BM> last night was the Chicagoland HubSpot Dev User Group. Matt Coley invited me to come up after his presentation and show off the extension, funny thing is it kind of tied somewhat directly in with his presentation on performance on HubSpot because of Will’s jQuery in the footer and HS Debug and Google PageSpeed features.

Seemed like people were interested in checking it out.

Also discovered a new feature to add. another query param button for `?hs_amp=true` Based on Matt’s presentation yesterday, a lot of big changes are coming regarding AMP on HubSpot, and this param is going to make it faster/easier to test AMP ready sites.
That is awesome Jon!

Usage stats on the extension - we’re at 17 installations 16 current users(guessing that means one person has the extension disabled or hidden)

11 impressions - no idea what that means.

0 uninstalls
<https://spin.d.pr/myGJr3+>
woowwww the dark theme
haha yea I demo’d that update last night and heard some people in the back go “finally!” so people like the idea
:tada: :tada:
Might be worth considering making the popup unique based on if your in the app or on live pages
Now, before it gets too complex
ooh that’s a cool idea.
I 100% agree with doing that.

one thing I’ve been thinking about though it might be over-kill.

Converting the popup to use vueJS as some functionality might require more “state management” for example if people can opt in to themes, or opt into design manager functionality down the road.

Concerns though using something like vuejs - if we move to frameworks like that it creates a barrier to entry for anyone willing to contribute. I would encourage not using a build process like babel either, as again it adds a barrier to entry for contributions. The advantage though is Vue is atleast easy to read even for someone not familiar with it. (that’s why I’d prefer that over something like react).

As I said, might be total overkill though, and possibly unneccessary depending on how far this extension actually grows out to handle.
How do i apply the dark theme? I can't get to option :disappointed:
<@U2H3TT8F2> it’s in a beta branch for the module, <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/tree/Dev-docs-links-feature> follow the instructions in the readme file to install it
We’re still working on that change as well as a few others that come in with that same change (such as a documentation shortcut)
Ah yes instructions, my arch-nemesis (apparently spelling is as well)
haha, need me to make an ikea diagram?
only if its in crayon
haha
Also, i think "ikea" should be in the languages filter and flips to a page designed like that
hahaha
i'd be happy to design it out
new option language settings, only 2 will be there, English and Ikea(comical swedish)
